venue.name: Hall Mountain Parking Lot just before

item.description:
Podunk Road starts off of North Road very near to this mailbox for 672 North Road, Candia, NH. Once on Podunk Road proceed 0.8 miles to the sign for the parking lot. At 0.6 miles Podunk Road intersects with Currier Road. and becomes a dirt road for the last 0.2 miles to the parking lot sign. The parking lot will be on the left side of Podunk Road.

This is a rear entrance to Bear Brook State Park in Candia, NH

Starting at the Hall Mountain Trailhead Parking Lot we will hike 0.2 miles to where the parking lot trail intersects with the Hall Mountain Trail.  Over the next 0.8 miles the trail ascends moderately for an elevation gain of 175 feet near the summit of Hall Mountain, descends in a sag 100 feet and then is uphill another 100 feet because of the sag in between 2 knobs of the mountain.  Then over the next 1.8 miles the trail descends 250 feet and ascends 75 feet to where it intersects with the Ferret Trail.  Then for the remaining 2.2 miles the trail ascends and descends at times because of smaller hills  but there were no references for me to figure out any gains or losses in elevation as one trail past Hall Mtn. Marsh is not on the park map or in a reference book.

Hunting season for deer will have closed as of Dec. 15, 2011 before this hike takes place.  Seasons for certain waterfowl, small game and fur bearing animals are still open.  Not of concern to me but you will have to decide for yourself. The link shows various hunting seasons and when they are open.

http://www.wildlife.state.nh.us/Hunting/hunting_dates_and_seasons.htm

Here is a link to a trail map if you care to print it out and bring it with you.

http://www.nhstateparks.org/uploads/pdf/BearBrookTrailsMap_2011-web.pdf

A trail guide with descriptions of the different trails:

http://www.nhstateparks.org/uploads/pdf/BearBrookTrailGuide.pdf
